snippet: The district attorney describes chaos in West Valley City, where many cases have had to be dropped and the killing of a suspect is under inquiry.
abstract: Accusations of bad police work in narcotics squad of West Valley City Police Department in Utah have engulfed town and sent shock waves through state's justice system; uproar began with November 2 killing of 21-year-old Danielle Willard, which touched off investigation into actions of officers in narcotics unit.
lead_paragraph: The district attorney describes chaos in West Valley City, where many cases have had to be dropped and the killing of a suspect is under inquiry.

headline.seo: Utah Town’s Police Force Under Scrutiny
headline.main: A ‘Pandora’s Box of Problems’ From a Police Shooting and Drugs in a Utah Town
headline.print_headline: A ‘Pandora’s Box of Problems’ From a Police Shooting and Drugs in a Utah Town
